result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan C. Victorio-Castelan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Juan C. Victorio-Castelan is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Juan C. Victorio-Castelan was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.   
*  Domestic Violence Surcharge ($100  ea applicable count).
  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  May not have contact with Maria D R, unless otherwise permitted by the court only.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Ct. 1
Ct. 2
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
Email sent to Atty Henry requesting Original Appeal Right & Original Firearm Warning be returned to the court.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Juan C. Victorio-Castelan, appeared with Attorney Aileen G. Henry.  Interpreter Alberto Aguilar in court.  Clerk: PT
Interpreter Aguilar is sworn in.  State is compliant with victim rights notification and case is resolved.  Count 1 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Count 2 - Dismissed by the State. Sentencing arguments made.    Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 18 months with conditions.  Cash Bond on deposit shall be applied to any costs.  No contact with Maria R. unless permitted by the court only.  Appeal Rights and Firearm Warning given.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Juan C. Victorio-Castelan, appeared with Attorney Aileen Henry.  Interpreter Leo Martin in court. (Court Reporter: T. Czarnecki)  Clerk: PT
Interpreter Martin is sworn in.  Arguments heard on DE motion to modify conditions of bond and upon hearing arguments motion is denied.  Atty Henry states case is resolved and requests plea & sentencing be adjourned to allow DE time to apply for the immigration program; no objection by the State.  Plea & Sentencing on 3/6/15 at 10:30 AM
for Reduction of Bail filed by Atty Henry
